title: Ticket #5427: HTCondor cannot start from init script if there is an empty pid file
description:
From: Dan Bradley

We recently had an incident where a partition filled up, condor died, and when attempts were made to restart it, it somehow created a zero-length /var/run/condor/condor_master.pid.

Then when the partition was fixed, the condor service still could not be started, because the condor init script detected the pid file, tried to read it, and freaked out because it got back an empty string. It also reported a confusing error message, "error: insufficient privileges" because it assumed the empty string it read from the file was a sign that it could not read from the file.
